ticket.title: HTML5 form field helpers (email_field_tag, etc.)
ticket.original-body:
As HTML5 becomes more popular, it would be nice to have convenience methods for the new input types.
This patch includes and tests the following:
* @email_field_tag@ (and @email_field@) * @url_field_tag@ (etc.) * @telephone_field_tag@ (aliased to @phone_field_tag@) * @number_field_tag@ * @range_field_tag@ * @search_field_tag@
All of the above function on (Mobile) Safari and Opera, and all will gracefully degrade across other browsers.
ticket.latest-body:
As HTML5 becomes more popular, it would be nice to have convenience methods for the new input types.
This patch includes and tests the following:
* @email_field_tag@ (and @email_field@) * @url_field_tag@ (etc.) * @telephone_field_tag@ (aliased to @phone_field_tag@) * @number_field_tag@ * @range_field_tag@ * @search_field_tag@
All of the above function on (Mobile) Safari and Opera, and all will gracefully degrade across other browsers.
ticket.original-body-html:
As HTML5 becomes more popular, it would be nice to have convenience methods for the new input types.

This patch includes and tests the following:

  • email_field_tag (and email_field)
  • url_field_tag (etc.)
  • telephone_field_tag (aliased to phone_field_tag)
  • number_field_tag
  • range_field_tag
  • search_field_tag

All of the above function on (Mobile) Safari and Opera, and all will gracefully degrade across other browsers.

version.body:

This patch includes and tests the following:

All of the above function on (Mobile) Safari and Opera, and all will gracefully degrade across other browsers.
version.body-html:
As HTML5 becomes more popular, it would be nice to have convenience methods for the new input types.

This patch includes and tests the following:

  • email_field_tag (and email_field)
  • url_field_tag (etc.)
  • telephone_field_tag (aliased to phone_field_tag)
  • number_field_tag
  • range_field_tag
  • search_field_tag

All of the above function on (Mobile) Safari and Opera, and all will gracefully degrade across other browsers.
version.title: HTML5 form field helpers (email_field_tag, etc.)

version.body:
+1
I think it's best to have this in now (3.0) than later.
version.body-html:
+1

I think it's best to have this in now (3.0) than later.
version.title: HTML5 form field helpers (email_field_tag, etc.)

version.body:
Additional patch that merely fixes the "text_field type: override" bug.
Discussion here: http://groups.google.com/group/rubyonrails-core/browse_thread/thread/2fae8ff7025d170a
I still think that we should prefer adding the helpers, as well, to encourage their use.
version.body-html:
Additional patch that merely fixes the "text_field type: override" bug.

Discussion here: http://groups.google.com/group/rubyonrails-core/browse_thread/threa...

I still think that we should prefer adding the helpers, as well, to encourage their use.
version.title: HTML5 form field helpers (email_field_tag, etc.)

version.body:
(from [2835ec6134b1e5b706824b568dfaba24672b7409]) Custom 'type' attribute support for text_field. [#3646 status:resolved]
Signed-off-by: José Valim <jose.valim@gmail.com> http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/2835ec6134b1e5b706824b568dfaba24672b7409
version.body-html:
(from [2835ec6134b1e5b706824b568dfaba24672b7409]) Custom 'type' attribute support for text_field. [#3646 status:resolved]

Signed-off-by: José Valim jose.valim@gmail.com
http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/2835ec6134b1e5b706824b568dfaba...
version.title: HTML5 form field helpers (email_field_tag, etc.)

version.body: Let's get the full helpers in. Could you rebase against master?
version.body-html: Let's get the full helpers in. Could you rebase against master?
version.title: HTML5 form field helpers (email_field_tag, etc.)

version.body: Interested in seeing autofocus and placeholder support with javascript fallback, too, if anyone wants to tackle in another ticket.
version.body-html: Interested in seeing autofocus and placeholder support with javascript fallback, too, if anyone wants to tackle in another ticket.
version.title: HTML5 form field helpers (email_field_tag, etc.)

version.body: (from [f8730e5ce6bba4de7639ac09c6c193458038f748]) Added all the new HTML5 form types as individual form tag methods (search, url, number, etc) (Closes #3646) [Stephen Celis] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f8730e5ce6bba4de7639ac09c6c193458038f748
version.body-html: (from [f8730e5ce6bba4de7639ac09c6c193458038f748]) Added all the new HTML5 form types as individual form tag methods (search, url, number, etc) (Closes #3646) [Stephen Celis] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f8730e5ce6bba4de7639ac09c6c193...
version.title: HTML5 form field helpers (email_field_tag, etc.)

version.body: On a certain cheap timberland boots day at a certain hour, we will pull into the station. Bands will be playing and flags discount timberland boots waving. Once we get there, so many wonderful timberland winter boots dreams will come true and the pieces of our lives will fit together like a completed jigsaw puzzle. How restlessly we pace the aisles, womens timberland boot the minutes for loitering --waiting, waiting, waiting for the station.But uppermost in our timberland shoes store minds is the final destination. On a certain day at a certain hour, we will pull into the station. Bands will be playing and timberland eye boat flags waving. Tucked away in our timberland for you subconscious is an idyllic vision. We see ourselves on a long trip that timberland 6 inch spans the continent. We are traveling by train. Out timberland hiking boots windows, we drink in the passing scene of cars on nearby highways, of children timberland shoe company waving at a crossing, of cattle grazing on a distant timberland boots hillside, of smoke pouring from a power plant, of row upon row of corn and wheat, of flatlands and timberland wheat shoes valleys, of mountains and rolling classic 3 eye timberland boat hillsides, of city skylines and village halls.But uppermost in our black timberland boots minds is the final destination.

version.title: HTML5 form field helpers (email_field_tag, etc.)

version.body: Hate to necro but is there any possible way to get this backported to 2.X? It is surprisingly painful to retrofit existing forms with HTML5 input types.
version.body-html: Hate to necro but is there any possible way to get this backported to 2.X? It is surprisingly painful to retrofit existing forms with HTML5 input types.
version.title: HTML5 form field helpers (email_field_tag, etc.)

version.body: @michaelxavier is it really that painful? text_field(:user, :email_address, :type => :email) has worked pretty well for me.
version.body-html: @michaelxavier is it really that painful? text_field(:user, :email_address, :type => :email) has worked pretty well for me.
version.title: HTML5 form field helpers (email_field_tag, etc.)
